member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Relay.HybridConnectionClient
member.summary: Provides a client for initiating new send-side HybridConnections.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Relay.HybridConnectionClient.#ctor(System.Uri)
member.summary: Create a new HybridConnectionClient instance for initiating HybridConnections where no client authentication is required.
member.param: The address on which to listen for HybridConnections. This address should be of the format "sb://contoso.servicebus.windows.net/yourhybridconnection".

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Relay.HybridConnectionClient.#ctor(System.Uri,Microsoft.Azure.Relay.TokenProvider)
member.summary: Create a new HybridConnectionClient instance for initiating HybridConnections with client authentication.
member.param: The address on which to listen for HybridConnections. This address should be of the format "sb://contoso.servicebus.windows.net/yourhybridconnection".
The TokenProvider for connecting to ServiceBus.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Relay.HybridConnectionClient.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of using the specified connection string.
member.param: The connection string to use. This connection string must include the EntityPath property.
member.exception: Thrown when the format of the parameter is incorrect.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Relay.HybridConnectionClient.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of from a connection string and the specified HybridConection path. Use this overload only when the connection string does not use the property.
member.param: The connection string used. This connection string must not include the EntityPath property.
The path to the HybridConnection.
member.exception: Thrown when the format of the parameter is incorrect.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Relay.HybridConnectionClient.Address
member.summary: Gets the address of this HybridConnection to connect through. The address on which to listen for HybridConnections. This address should be of the format "sb://contoso.servicebus.windows.net/yourhybridconnection".

member.summary: Gets or sets proxy information for connecting to ServiceBus.

member.summary: Gets the TokenProvider for authenticating HybridConnections.

member.summary: Gets or sets the timeout used when connecting a HybridConnection. Default value is 70 seconds.

member.summary: Gets or sets the connection buffer size. Default value is 64K.

member.summary: Gets the for this HybridConnection entity using the default timeout. Unless specified in the connection string the default is 1 minute.

member.summary: Build the websocket uri for use with HybridConnection WebSockets. Results in a Uri such as "wss://HOST:PORT/$hc/PATH?QUERY&sb-hc-action=listen&sb-hc-id=ID"
member.param: The host name (required).
The port (-1 is allowed).
The hybridConnection path.
An optional query string.
The action (listen|connect|accept).
The tracking id.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Relay.HybridConnectionUtility.FilterQueryString(System.String)
member.summary: Filters out any query string values which start with the 'sb-hc-' prefix. The returned string never has a '?' character at the start.

member.summary: Filters out any query string values which start with the 'sb-hc-' prefix. The returned string never has a '?' character at the start.

member.summary: Builds a query string, e.g. "existing=stuff_here&sb-hc-action=listen&sb-hc-id=TRACKING_ID"

member.name: E:Microsoft.Azure.Relay.HybridConnectionListener.Connecting
member.summary: Raised when the Listener is attempting to reconnect with ServiceBus after a connection loss.

member.name: E:Microsoft.Azure.Relay.HybridConnectionListener.Online
member.summary: Raised when the Listener has successfully connected with ServiceBus

member.name: E:Microsoft.Azure.Relay.HybridConnectionListener.Offline
member.summary: Raised when the Listener will no longer be attempting to (re)connect with ServiceBus.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Relay.HybridConnectionListener.IsOnline
member.summary: Gets a value that determines whether the connection is online.
member.value: true if the connection is alive and online; false if there is no connectivity towards the Azure Service Bus from the current network location.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Relay.HybridConnectionListener.LastError
member.summary: Retrieves the last error encountered when trying to reestablish the connection from the offline state.
member.value: Returns a that contains the last error.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Relay.HybridConnectionListener.AcceptHandler
member.summary: Allows installing a custom handler which can inspect request headers, control response headers, decide whether to accept or reject a web-socket upgrade request, and control the status code/description if rejecting. The AcceptHandler should return true to accept a client request or false to reject.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Relay.HybridConnectionListener.Address
member.summary: Gets the address on which to listen for HybridConnections. This address should be of the format "sb://contoso.servicebus.windows.net/yourhybridconnection".

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Relay.RelayedHttpListenerResponse.StatusDescription

member.returns: The text description of the HTTP status code returned to the client.
member.exception: The value specified for a set operation is null.
The value specified for a set operation contains non-printable characters.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Relay.RelayEventSource
member.summary:
EventSource for the new Dynamic EventSource type of Microsoft-Azure-Relay traces.
The default Level is Informational
When defining Start/Stop tasks, the StopEvent.Id must be exactly StartEvent.Id + 1.
Do not explicity include the Guid here, since EventSource has a mechanism to automatically map to an EventSource Guid based on the Name (Microsoft-Azure-Relay). The Guid will be consistent as long as the name stays Microsoft-Azure-Relay

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Relay.Strings.AcceptHandlerException
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The Listener's custom AcceptHandler threw an exception. See Listener logs for details. TrackingId: {0}..

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Relay.Strings.ArgumentInvalidCombination
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Ensure either all or none of the following arguments are defined: '{0}'..

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Relay.Strings.ArgumentOutOfRange
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The argument is out of range. It should be between {0} and {1}..

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Relay.Strings.ArgumentStringTooBig
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The argument '{0}' cannot exceed {1} characters..

member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to '{0}' contained character '{1}' which is not allowed because it is reserved in the Uri scheme..

member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to {0} name should be specified as EntityPath in connectionString..

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Relay.Strings.ConnectionStringMustIncludeTokenProviderSettings
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The connectionString must include either SharedAccessSignature or both SharedAccessKeyName and SharedAccessKey..

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Relay.Strings.ConnectionStringMustNotIncludeEntityPath

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Relay.ExceptionExtensions.Rethrow(System.Exception)
M:Microsoft.Azure.Relay.ExceptionExtensions.ThrowException(System.Exception)
member.summary: ThrowException is a helper/wrapper method that simply calls "throw exception;". This wrapper method exists so that the calling method (Rethrow) will indeed get inlined (having a direct throw in Rethrow causes it to not be inlined any more).

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Relay.TaskEx.FromAsync(System.Func{System.AsyncCallback,System.Object,System.IAsyncResult},System.Action{System.IAsyncResult},System.Object)
member.summary: Create a Task based on Begin/End IAsyncResult pattern. This is a wrapper around Task.Factory.FromAsync with the additional guarantee that if the begin delegate throws an Exception it will result in a Task with that exception instead of the exception being thrown from this method.
member.param: This parameter helps reduce allocations by passing state to the Funcs. e.g.: await TaskEx.FromAsync( (c, s) => ((Transaction)s).BeginCommit(c, s), (a) => ((Transaction)a.AsyncState).EndCommit(a), transaction);

member.summary: Create a Task based on Begin/End IAsyncResult pattern. This is a wrapper around Task.Factory.FromAsync with the additional guarantee that if the begin delegate throws an Exception it will result in a Task with that exception instead of the exception being thrown from this method.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Relay.TaskEx.FromException(System.Exception)
member.summary: Creates a Task that has completed with a specified exception. Once the code has moved to .NET 4.6 just use Task.FromException;

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Relay.TaskEx.FromException``1(System.Exception)
member.summary: Creates a Task<TResult> that's completed with a specified exception. Once the code has moved to .NET 4.6 just use Task.FromException<TResult>

member.summary: Create a TrackingContext with a new Guid/TrackingId and given subsystemId.
member.param: subsystem-specific Uri like entity address to be used in the tracking context

member.summary: Create a TrackingContext with a new Guid/TrackingId and given subsystemId.
member.param: subsystem-specific identifier to be used in the tracking context

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Relay.TrackingContext.RemoveSuffix(System.String)
member.summary: Given a trackingId string with "_GXX" suffix remove that suffix. Example: "1c048eb5-77c4-4b85-96fd-fa526801af35_G0" becomes "1c048eb5-77c4-4b85-96fd-fa526801af35"

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Relay.TrackingContext.CreateTrackableErrorMessage(System.String)
member.summary: Ensures the given string contains a TrackingId. If one is already present, nothing occurs. Otherwise TrackingId, Timestamp, and if present, SystemTracker are added.
